member.name: T:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration
member.summary: SMARTS is a library and supporting ecosystem that allows applications to report on their own health. See http://sharepoint.sentry.com/IT/AppSvcs/architecture/DeveloperWiki/Wiki%20Pages/Sentry.Smarts.aspx for more info.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.SmartsConfigurationSectionName
member.summary: The XML name of the SmartsConfiguration Configuration Section.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.Instance
member.summary: Gets the SmartsConfiguration instance.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.XmlnsPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.Xmlns
member.summary: Gets the XML namespace of this Configuration Section.
member.remarks: This property makes sure that if the configuration file contains the XML namespace, the parser doesn't throw an exception because it encounters the unknown "xmlns" attribute.

member.name: M:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element is read-only.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.ServiceNamePropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.ServiceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the service/site to be monitored.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.RefreshIntervalPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.RefreshInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum amount of time (in seconds) to wait before allowing the refresh/re-query of resources. Default: 60 seconds

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.CacheExpirationPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.CacheExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time (in seconds) for clients of your SMARTS page to cache the response received from your SMARTS page. This is done by setting the appropriate cache-control headers. Default: none

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.DatabasesPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.Databases
member.summary: Gets or sets database resources attempt to establish a connection to the configured database and optionally execute a query against it.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.WebServicesPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.WebServices
member.summary: Gets or sets web Service resources attempt to make a HTTP connection to the specified URL and simply look for a status code 200 returned.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.SmartsServicesPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.SmartsServices
member.summary: Gets or sets sMARTS Service resources are just like web service resource except they should be pointed at another system’s SMARTS URL and go the extra step of checking the response body to verify the target service’s SMARTS page reports it as up.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.WindowsServicesPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.WindowsServices
member.summary: Gets or sets windows Service resources monitor the status of Windows service processes running on the local machine.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.FileNotExistsPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.FileNotExists
member.summary: Gets or sets the File Not Exists resource is available to be used as a quick mechanism to manually force a service to report as down. Creating an empty file by the specified (or default) name will cause that resource to be considered down.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.FileExistsPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.FileExists
member.summary: Gets or sets the File Exists resource is available to be used as a mechanism to manually force a service to report as down. A file with the specified (or default) name must exist for the resource to be considered up.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.CommandsPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.Commands
member.summary: Gets or sets command resources allow you to invoke an arbitrary external command and use the exit code of that process to indicate whether or not the resource is up or down.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.CustomResourcesPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.CustomResources
member.summary: Gets or sets custom resources allow you to specify your own class to implement whatever specific needs you may have. Class instances will be loaded dynamically during initialization and must implement the IResource interface.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.EventingQueuesPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.EventingQueues
member.summary: Gets or sets eventing Queue resources attempt to connect to the configured Sentry.Eventing (>=1.0) message queue system to determine if it is available. For .Net, it requires that Sentry.Eventing.dll and Sentry.Eventing.RabbitAMQPProvider.dll be present in the bin directory, as these will be loaded dynamically at runtime.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.RabbitMQsPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.RabbitMQs
member.summary: Gets or sets rabbitMQ resources attempt to connect to a RabbitMQ queueing system via the AMQP protocol.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.RedisServicesPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.SmartsConfiguration.RedisServices
member.summary: Gets or sets redisServices resources attempt to connect to the Redis server(s) specified.

member.summary: The FileExistenceResource Configuration Element.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element is read-only.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.FileExistenceResource.FilePropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.FileExistenceResource.File
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file to monitor (can be a relative path, which is relative to the root of your web application). Defaults to smarts_up.txt for a FileExists resource, and smarts_down.txt for a FileNotExists resource

member.name: T:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource
member.summary: The Resource Configuration Element.

member.name: M:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the element is read-only.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.NamePropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name for this resource.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.IsRequiredPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.IsRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets if required, the resource being down causes the whole service to be considered down, otherwise the service is considered “degraded”. Default: true

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.RefreshIntervalPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.RefreshInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum amount of time to wait before refreshing this resource. If left unset the global refreshInterval setting is used (which has a default of 5 seconds).

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.IsHiddenPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.IsHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets if the resource is marked as hidden, whenever its status is up it will not be shown in the list of resources. Default: false

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.TimeoutPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time to wait for the resource to respond, in seconds. It will default to 5 seconds if unspecified. However, the framework will always timeout a resource once the the refresh interval minus one second has passed (to prevent potential overlapping resource requests). If a resource times out, then it is treated as being "DOWN". This setting is only honored by these resources: command, database, smarts, web service, and HornetQ.

member.name: F:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.CheckedByLoadBalancerPropertyName
member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.Resource.CheckedByLoadBalancer
member.summary: Gets or sets if marked true, then this resource is included when calculating the composite resource status when the ?mode=LB query string is passed to SMARTS. This would then cause your application to be pulled out of the load balancer if the resource is down. Default: false

member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the IgnoreDegraded.

member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.DatabaseResource.QueryResultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the expected value in the specified column of the first row of the query result set. If the values do not match, the resource will be considered down.

member.summary: The XML name of the property.

member.name: P:Sentry.Smarts.Configuration.CommandResource.SuccessCodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the declaration of what exit codes constitutes the resource being up. Typically you should only specify either successCodes or failureCodes. Accepts a syntax of comma-separated integers or integer ranges denoted by "..". Valid examples include: "0", "0,1", "0..10", and "0..10,15".

member.summary: Returns a SmartsViewModel object wrapping the current status of the SmartsService. If the given query-string parameters specify the 'force' switch, each resource will be refreshed.
member.param: Specifies if and how the resources should be refreshed.

member.name: T:Sentry.Smarts.Service.SmartsService
member.summary: Central Service for SMARTS functionality. Provides methods for loading resources, parsing param flags and retrieving resource status

member.name: T:My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:Conversation
member.summary: Represents all the details about one SMARTS conversation, which is a series of SMARTS-to-SMARTS interactions that result from some client asking a SMARTS page for a status.
